    "content": "# Hypernet Funding Plan: Executive Summary
## $100M Year-One Strategy

**Prepared:** 2026-02-04
**For:** Matt Schaeffer, CEO/Founder
**Status:** Ready for Execution

---

## The Opportunity in One Page

**What We're Building:**
The data infrastructure layer for personal AI agents - "Snowflake for your digital life"

**Market Size:**
- Total: $4.5 Trillion (global personal data market)
- Serviceable: $50 Billion (U.S. + Europe)
- Target: $500M revenue by year 5

**Timing:**
Perfect. AI boom + data privacy regulations + consumer backlash against Big Tech = massive demand for exactly what we're building.

**What We Have:**
- ✅ 19 data models built
- ✅ 61 REST API endpoints production-ready
- ✅ Technical foundation complete
- ⏳ Need: users, partnerships, capital, team

**What We Need:**
$100M in year one through:
1. Angels: $7.5M (months 1-3)
2. Seed VC: $20M (months 4-6)
3. Corporate Strategic: $40M (months 6-9)
4. Series A or Grants: $30M+ (months 9-12)

---

## The $100M Roadmap

### Phase 1: Angel Round ($7.5M) - Months 1-3

**Target Investors:**
- Sam Altman ($2M) - OpenAI needs this infrastructure
- Naval Ravikant ($1M) - Data sovereignty thesis
- Balaji Srinivasan ($1M) - Anti-Big Tech, pro-sovereignty
- Elad Gil ($1.5M) - Infrastructure pattern recognition
- Chamath Palihapitiya ($2M) - SPAC pathway, anti-Big Tech

**Plus 10-15 additional angels at $250-500K each**

**Milestones to Unlock:**
- 1,000 beta users
- 2-3 partnership LOIs (AI companies)
- $10-50K MRR
- Team of 8-12 people

**Timeline:**
- Weeks 1-2: Team building, advisor recruitment
- Weeks 3-4: Pitch materials, beta launch prep
- Weeks 5-8: Warm intro outreach, meetings
- Weeks 9-12: Close round

### Phase 2: Seed VC Round ($20M) - Months 4-6

**Target Firms:**
- Andreessen Horowitz ($10M lead) - American Dynamism + AI
- General Catalyst ($8M co-lead) - Responsible innovation
- Greylock ($7M) - Infrastructure + consumer
- Kleiner Perkins ($5M) - Green growth angle
- Benchmark ($5M) - Pure infrastructure play

**Milestones to Unlock:**
- 5,000 users
- $100K MRR
- 2-3 partnerships signed
- Public launch (out of beta)

**Timeline:**
- Weeks 13-16: VC prep (deck refinement, data room)
- Weeks 17-24: VC pitch circuit, partner meetings
- Weeks 25-28: Term sheets, negotiation, close

### Phase 3: Strategic Corporate Round ($40M) - Months 6-9

**Target Companies:**
- Salesforce Ventures ($10-15M) - AI Cloud integration
- Google Ventures ($8-12M) - Gemini personalization
- Microsoft M12 ($8-12M) - Copilot enhancement
- Anthropic ($5-8M) - Claude personal context
- Intel Capital ($5-10M) - Edge AI strategy

**Milestones to Unlock:**
- 10,000+ users
- $500K MRR
- 5-7 strategic partnerships with revenue
- Enterprise pilots

**Timeline:**
- Weeks 29-32: Partnership POCs
- Weeks 33-38: Corporate VC process
- Weeks 39-40: Close and announce

### Phase 4: Series A or Grants ($30M+) - Months 9-12

**Option A: Series A**
- Top-tier VCs (Sequoia, Benchmark, a16z institutional)
- $30-50M at $150-250M post-money valuation
- If momentum is strong

**Option B: Grant Focus**
- NSF Convergence Accelerator: $5M
- EU EIC Accelerator: $19M
- DoD programs: $3M
- State programs: $1M
- Foundations: $2M
- **Total: $30M non-dilutive**

**Milestones:**
- 25,000-50,000 users
- $1M MRR
- 10+ enterprise customers
- Clear path to profitability

---

## Critical Success Factors

### Must-Have #1: Technical Co-Founder/CTO

**Why Critical:**
- Technical credibility with investors
- Engineering leadership
- Product development speed
- Investor confidence

**Target Profile:**
- Staff+ engineer from FAANG or leading AI company (Google, OpenAI, Anthropic, Meta)
- Distributed systems or API infrastructure background
- Startup experience (bonus)
- Passionate about data sovereignty and AI

**Compensation:**
- 8-12% equity (4-year vesting with 1-year cliff)
- Market salary ($250-400K depending on experience)
- Co-founder title and authority

**Where to Find:**
- YC co-founder matching
- LinkedIn targeted outreach
- AI/ML conferences
- Referrals from advisors

**Timeline:** Must hire within 60 days to maintain credibility with VCs

### Must-Have #2: Early Traction

**Metrics Needed for Angel Round:**
- 100-500 beta users (achievable in 60 days)
- 1-2 partnership discussions or LOIs
- Working product demo
- Some revenue or clear path to revenue

**How to Get Traction:**

**Week 1-2:**
- Build simple user interface for beta
- Set up user onboarding flow
- Create landing page and waitlist

**Week 3-4:**
- Launch on ProductHunt
- Post on HackerNews (Show HN)
- Share on Twitter/LinkedIn
- Target AI enthusiast communities (r/MachineLearning, AI Discord servers)

**Week 5-8:**
- User interviews and testimonials
- Iterate based on feedback
- Build 2-3 showcase integrations (ChatGPT plugin, personal AI assistant demo)
- Begin partnership conversations with AI companies

**Week 9-12:**
- Hit 500-1000 users
- Get 5-10 strong testimonials
- Secure at least 1 partnership LOI
- Generate first revenue ($1-10K)

### Must-Have #3: Compelling Narrative

**The Story We Tell:**

> "Three companies control 80% of the world's personal data. That data is worth $500-5000 per person per year, but individuals see none of it. Meanwhile, AI companies are desperate for personal data to make their assistants actually useful.
>
> We're building the infrastructure that solves both problems: individuals reclaim ownership of their data, and AI companies get access to rich personal context - all with user permission and control.
>
> This is the Snowflake of personal data. The Plaid of your digital life. The data layer for the AI revolution.
>
> We have the technology built, partnerships forming, and we're raising $100M to scale this into a $5B+ company."

**Why This Works:**
- Clear problem everyone understands
- Massive market ($4.5T)
- Perfect timing (AI boom + privacy concerns)
- Technical capability proven (we have the product)
- Clear business model (B2B + B2C)
- Defensible moats (first-mover, network effects, data gravity)

### Must-Have #4: World-Class Advisors

**Target Advisory Board (5-7 people):**

1. **AI/ML Expert**
   - Target: Former researcher from OpenAI, Anthropic, Google Brain, DeepMind
   - Value: Technical credibility, AI company intros, product guidance
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

2. **Privacy/Security Expert**
   - Target: Former GDPR regulator, privacy lawyer, or CISO from tech company
   - Value: Regulatory navigation, compliance, trust
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

3. **Enterprise SaaS Expert**
   - Target: Former executive who scaled B2B company to $100M+ revenue
   - Value: Go-to-market strategy, enterprise sales, partnerships
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

4. **Consumer Growth Expert**
   - Target: Former growth leader from Dropbox, Notion, Discord, or similar
   - Value: User acquisition, viral growth, product-market fit
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

5. **Venture Capital Investor**
   - Target: Partner at top-tier VC or successful angel investor
   - Value: Fundraising strategy, investor intros, credibility
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

6. **Strategic Corporate Executive (Optional)**
   - Target: VP/SVP from Salesforce, Microsoft, Google focusing on AI
   - Value: Partnership pathways, enterprise credibility
   - Equity: 0.25-0.5%

7. **Data Ethics/Policy Expert (Optional)**
   - Target: Academic or policy leader in data rights
   - Value: Mission credibility, regulatory relationships, PR
   - Equity: 0.25%

**How to Recruit Advisors:**
- Lead with mission and vision (data sovereignty, AI future)
- Show what you've built (technical credibility)
- Ask for 2-4 hours per month (quarterly calls + ad-hoc emails)
- Offer equity with 2-year vesting
- Make it prestigious (select group, association with successful company)

---

## Realistic Assessment: Can We Hit $100M?

### Best Case Scenario: $100-130M ✅

**If Everything Goes Right:**
- Find amazing CTO in 30 days
- Hit 1000 users in 60 days
- Angels oversubscribe ($10M instead of $7.5M)
- Seed VC competitive bidding ($25M instead of $20M)
- 2-3 corporate strategics invest heavily ($50M total)
- Strong momentum leads to Series A ($30-50M)
- **Total: $115-135M**

**Probability:** 15-20%

**What Needs to Happen:**
- Perfect execution on all fronts
- Market timing stays favorable
- No major competitors emerge
- Key partnerships close
- Viral growth or major PR moment

### Likely Scenario: $50-75M ✅

**If Things Go Well:**
- Find solid CTO in 60-90 days
- Hit 500-1000 users
- Angel round closes at $5-7.5M
- Seed VC at $15-20M
- Corporate strategic at $25-35M
- Grants: $5-10M
- **Total: $50-72.5M**

**Probability:** 40-50%

**What Needs to Happen:**
- Solid execution
- Normal fundraising timeline
- 1-2 key partnerships
- Steady user growth

### Challenged Scenario: $20-40M ⚠️

**If Things Are Slower:**
- CTO search takes 6+ months
- User growth slower than expected
- Angel round: $3-5M
- Seed VC: $10-15M
- Corporate strategic: $10-20M
- Grants: $3-5M
- **Total: $26-45M**

**Probability:** 30-40%

**What Happens:**
- Longer runway needed
- More dilution
- Slower growth
- But still viable path

### Worst Case Scenario: <$20M or Pivot ⚠️

**If Major Issues:**
- Can't find CTO
- No user traction
- Market shifts negatively
- Big Tech announces competing solution
- **Need to bootstrap, pivot, or shut down**
... [truncated]
